name: Potato Salad Worthy of the Cookout
ingredients: ¼ cup inglehoffer stone ground mustard
method: 1. Rinse potatoes and place them in a pot. Fill the pot with cold water, makingsure potatoes are covered and add the chicken or vegetable bouillon Bring the pot to boil and lower the heat to medium. Cook until potatoes are tender. (You can stick a fork into the middle of a potato to test it.) Drain off water and let potatoes cool to room temperature.
2. Dice potatoes and eggs into small cubes and add to a large mixing bowl.
3. Grate onion, and celery into even sized pieces and add it to the mixing bowl along with the relish. Gently mix everything together with a wooden spoon.
4. In a small bowl, combine mayo, mustard, hot sauce, garlic powder, salt, and pepper and mix well. Add the mayo mixture to the potato mixture and mix everything together.
5. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Onigiri
ingredients: 2 large filets cooked salmon, flavored as desired
method: 1. Cook sushi rice according to rice cooker directions
2. Break up the salmon with a fork and mix with mayo and gochujang
3. Once rice is finished cooking, add the rice vinegar and salt to taste. Mix well, taking care not to break the rice grains.
4. Using your hands or an onigiri shaper, enclose the salmon mixture in your desired amount of rice and shape.
5. Wrap the onigiri with the strips of nori. Serve with soy sauce.

name: Pancakes
method: 2. Mix wet ingredients into dry mixture, taking care not to over mix.
3. Allow the mixture to sit for at least 5 minutes to aerate.
4. In a lightly greased pan over medium-low heat, pour 1/2 cup of batter at a time. Allow to cook to golden brown before flipping.
